intro: Stoebe prostrata, commonly known as prostrate devil's-bit manroot, is a low-growing perennial herb native to North America. It features a mat-forming growth habit with small, opposite leaves that are typically oval to ovate in shape. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers in late spring to early summer. Its roots are fibrous and often have a distinctive, reddish-brown color. Stoebe prostrata is adapted to moist, shady environments and is often found in woodland areas.
